snippet: The adviser to a government group received “large payments” from the technology company, whose pricing is being investigated, state news media said.
abstract: Zhang Xinzhu, adviser to Chinese government antitrust committee, is dismissed following claims that he accepted payments from American technology company Qualcomm, which is under investigation in China on suspicion of antitrust violations.

byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Quentin Hardy contributed reporting from San Francisco, and Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The adviser to a government group received “large payments” from the technology company, whose pricing is being investigated, state news media said.

headline.main: Adviser to Government in Chinese Investigation of Qualcomm Is Ousted
headline.print_headline: Adviser to Government in Chinese Investigation of Qualcomm Is Ousted
